meaning: A period of difficulty
example: He is going through a bad patch.

meaning: An animal that carries luggage
example: The camel is a beast of burden.

meaning: A busy place
example: The station looked like a bee hive.

meaning: Huge attraction
example: The match was a big draw.

phrase: A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush
meaning: Having something for certain is better than the possibility of getting something better
hindiMeaning: कुछ निश्चित रूप से होना, कुछ बेहतर पाने की उम्मीद से अच्छा है
example: He accepted the offer because a bird in the hand is worth two in the bush.

meaning: A general view from above / Aerial view / Good and comprehensive idea / An overall view
example: We had a bird’s eye view of the city.

meaning: An attempt or opportunity to do something
example: He got another bite at the cherry.

meaning: An apparent misfortune that eventually has good results / A hidden favour
example: Failure was a blessing in disguise.

meaning: One who is favourite
example: He is the blue-eyed boy of his teacher.

meaning: Something unexpected and unpleasant / A complete surprise / A sudden calamity / An unexpected disaster
example: His death was a bolt from the blue.

meaning: Cause of dispute / quarrel / Point of an argument
example: Property became a bone of contention.

phrase: A bull in a China shop
meaning: A clumsy person in a delicate situation
example: He acts like a bull in a China shop.

meaning: A period of rising prices in the stock market
hindiMeaning: शेयर बाजार में कीमतों में वृद्धि
example: Investors are happy in a bull market.

meaning: An easy achievement / An easy task or victory
example: Winning the match was a cakewalk.

meaning: A complicated situation or problem
example: Don’t open that issue, it’s a can of worms.

meaning: Rewards and punishments that influence someone's behavior
hindiMeaning: प्रोत्साहन और दंड का मिश्रित उपयोग
example: The teacher used carrot and stick approach.

meaning: A change in one's opinion / Different opinion
example: He had a change of heart.

meaning: Situation in which you can start again
hindiMeaning: फिर से शुरू करने का अवसर
example: Let us begin with a clean slate.

meaning: A mystery
example: Maths is a closed book for me.

meaning: A miser
example: He is a close-fisted person.

meaning: Very small part of a big organisation
example: He is just a cog in the machine.

meaning: Someone who seems unfriendly and who does not share his feelings
hindiMeaning: भावनाओं को साझा नहीं करने वाला आदमी
example: He is a cold fish and never talks much.

meaning: An unwelcome intruder
example: He felt like a cuckoo in the nest.

meaning: Superior to
example: His work is a cut above others.

meaning: A disappointing result / a situation or event which is much less impressive than expected
example: The show turned out to be a damp squib.

meaning: A helpless woman
example: She looked like a damsel in distress.

meaning: An unexpected winner / someone who unexpectedly succeeds / an unknown entry / a competitor of unknown capabilities
example: He emerged as a dark horse in the election.

meaning: A law or agreement that is no longer enforced or followed
example: This rule has become a dead letter.

meaning: Completely useless
example: He proved to be a dead loss.

meaning: Someone or something with potential or talent but lacking training or polish
example: He is a diamond in the rough.

meaning: Very common and of no particular value / Anything that is common and easy to get
example: Such books are a dime a dozen.

meaning: A total mess
example: His room is a dog's breakfast.

meaning: A miserable existence
example: He is living a dog's life.

meaning: A very small part of something big or whole / A quantity too small to make an impact
hindiMeaning: ऊंट के मुँह में जीरा (बहुत कम)
example: His help was just a drop in the ocean.

meaning: Rehearsal of an event / a practice session
example: We had a dry run before the program.

meaning: An unpleasant situation
example: This is a fine state of affairs.

meaning: One who is energetic and enthusiastic about something
example: He has a fire in his belly.

meaning: An uncomfortable, unfamiliar or unsuitable position or situation / A person out of accustomed
example: He felt like a fish out of water in the city.

meaning: An unperceived observer
example: I wish I were a fly on the wall.

meaning: A very short visit
example: He paid a flying visit.

meaning: Being happy for foolish reasons / a state of happiness based on a person's not knowing about potential trouble
hindiMeaning: हवाई महल (संभावित परेशानी नहीं जानने पर खुशी की स्थिति)
example: He lives in a fool's paradise.

meaning: A man without a job
example: He is a gentleman at large.

meaning: Middle course between two extremes / neither too much nor too little
example: We should follow the golden mean.

meaning: A helpful person
example: He is a Good Samaritan.

meaning: An inexperienced man
example: He is still a green horn.

meaning: An area where things aren't clearly defined / An unclear situation
example: This issue falls in a grey area.

meaning: A challenging situation
example: This project is a hair in the butter.

meaning: Telling about the smallest possible amount or degree of something
hindiMeaning: बहुत बारीकी के साथ विवरण देना
example: He escaped by a hair’s breadth.

meaning: A narrow escape / narrow margin
example: It was a hairbreadth escape.

meaning: Difficult task / A tough challenge / A difficult person / An inflexible person who is hard to convince
example: This problem is a hard nut to crack.

meaning: An unpleasant, difficult or troublesome situation / Raising controversy
example: He stirred up a hornet’s nest.

meaning: A controversial issue/situation that is difficult to deal with
example: This topic is a hot potato.

meaning: A fragile or unstable situation that can easily collapse or fail
hindiMeaning: ताश का घर (नाजुक या अस्थिर स्थिति)
example: His business was a house of cards.

meaning: A grave setback / Great disappointment
example: Losing the match was a kick in the teeth.

meaning: Unsatisfactory explanation / Weak excuse
example: He gave a lame excuse.

meaning: An object of laughter / an object of ridicule
example: He became a laughing stock.

meaning: A period of poor performance
example: He is going through a lean patch.

meaning: An ambiguous compliment / insulting remark appearing as praise
hindiMeaning: प्रशंसा के रूप में अपमानजनक टिप्पणी
example: That was a left handed compliment.

phrase: A leopard can’t change its spots
meaning: It is impossible for one to change one's character
hindiMeaning: कुत्ते की पूँछ टेढ़ी की टेढ़ी (किसी के चरित्र को बदलना असंभव है)
example: He cheated again— a leopard can’t change its spots.

meaning: To keep the identity of informant secret / receive information from a secret source
hindiMeaning: अपने मुखबिर की पहचान गुप्त रखने का तरीका
example: A little bird told me about your success.

meaning: Friendly feeling
example: She showed a little gush of gratitude.

meaning: A person who is full of energy
example: He is a live wire in the team.

meaning: Little chance of success
example: Winning this match is a long shot.

meaning: To have a large number of problems to deal with / having many responsibilities
example: I can’t help now, I have a lot on my plate.

meaning: Proficient in literary art / Scholar / A well educated and a wise person
example: He is a man of letters.

meaning: A wealthy man with lots of money and assets
example: He is a man of means.

meaning: A very courageous man
example: He is a man of spirit.

meaning: A man of no substance / A weak or cowardly person
example: He proved to be a man of straw.

meaning: A difficult/complicated situation / A false invention
example: The whole plan turned out to be a mare’s nest.

meaning: A long time
example: It will take a month of Sundays to finish.

meaning: Disputed
example: Whether he will win is a moot point.

meaning: Something that is very difficult to locate / Attempting something impossible
example: Finding him is like a needle in a haystack.

meaning: A person who prefers to be awake late at night
hindiMeaning: देर रात तक जागने वाला व्यक्ति

meaning: A fool
example: Don’t behave like a nig-nog.

meaning: Someone or something that is annoying/irritating or a nuisance
example: That noise is a pain in the neck.

meaning: An endless job
example: Cleaning this office is a Penelope’s web.

meaning: A way of asking what someone is thinking
hindiMeaning: कोई क्या सोच रहा है यह पूछने का तरीका
example: You look serious, a penny for your thoughts?

meaning: A particularly bad situation caused by a combination of unfavorable circumstances
example: Rising prices created a perfect storm.

phrase: A picture paints a thousand words
meaning: An image of a subject conveys its meaning more effectively than a description does
hindiMeaning: एक तस्वीर हजार शब्दों के बराबर होती है
example: This photo proves that a picture paints a thousand words.

meaning: A very easy task
example: The exam was a piece of cake.

meaning: A share in money or business
example: Everyone wants a piece of the pie.

meaning: An easy pleasant job that also pays well
example: He got a plum job.

meaning: An eccentric or unconventional person
example: He is a queer fish.

meaning: Time of difficulty
example: Save money for a rainy day.

meaning: Something that provides a small amount of optimism in a difficult situation
example: This news is a ray of hope.

meaning: An important day / a day that is pleasantly noteworthy or memorable / happy and significant day
example: Today is a red letter day for me.

phrase: A red rag to a bull
meaning: An object, utterance, or act which is certain to provoke someone
example: His comment was a red rag to a bull.

phrase: A rolling stone gathers no moss
meaning: A person who does not settle in one place for a long time, does not gain wealth, name or fame
hindiMeaning: अस्थिरता से कभी सफलता नहीं मिलती
example: He keeps changing jobs—a rolling stone gathers no moss.

meaning: A single bad person or thing in a group
example: One rotten apple spoils the basket.

meaning: A person never to be criticised
example: That rule is a sacred cow here.

meaning: A reliable person / A person who can be trusted to do something efficiently
example: Give the project to him, he is a safe pair of hands.

meaning: A profound or notable transformation / Complete transformation
example: There has been a sea change in his behavior.

meaning: An encouraging stimulus / something that gives encouragement
example: This success is a shot in the arm for him.

meaning: A person or thing that one is extremely pleased or relieved to see
example: Meeting you is a sight for sore eyes.

meaning: An embarrassing fact to be kept secret / something embarrassing or shameful
example: Every family has a skeleton in the cupboard.

meaning: An accelerating growth of magnitude
hindiMeaning: छोटी घटना का धीरे-धीरे बड़ा होना
example: The problem had a snowball effect.

meaning: Something which hurts
example: His failure is still a sore point.

meaning: A fair agreement / A fair and honest deal
example: We expect a square deal.

meaning: A person who resists change
hindiMeaning: रूढ़िवादी व्यक्ति (जो बदलाव में विश्वास नहीं करता)

meaning: An obstinate person
example: Don’t argue with him, he is stiff-necked.

phrase: A stitch in time saves nine
meaning: It is better to solve a problem straight away and not let it become bigger
hindiMeaning: किसी समस्या का समाधान उसके ज्यादा बढ़ने से पहले कर देना अच्छा है
example: Repair it now— a stitch in time saves nine.

meaning: A very short distance
example: The school is a stone’s throw away.

meaning: Big fuss over a small matter / A lot of anger, excitement or worry about trivial things
example: It’s just a storm in a teacup.

meaning: A pompous or self-important person
hindiMeaning: अहंकारी या स्वयं को महत्वपूर्ण समझने वाला व्यक्ति

meaning: An obstacle to progress
example: Lack of money is a stumbling block.

meaning: A source of continual annoyance or trouble / Annoying and irritating
hindiMeaning: आँख का काँटा (निरंतर समस्या या परेशानी)
example: He is a thorn in my flesh.

meaning: Anything that brings about changes / The time at which an important change starts
example: This match was a turning point.

meaning: Controversial
example: This is a vexed question.

meaning: When one problem causes another problem
hindiMeaning: दुष्चक्र में फँसना (एक के बाद एक समस्या आना)

meaning: A person's occupation or position within society
hindiMeaning: किसी व्यक्ति का काम या स्तर
example: People from every walk of life attended.

meaning: A person who discourages enjoyment or enthusiasm / someone who prevents other people from having fun

meaning: A strike by workers without official union support
hindiMeaning: यूनियन की मंजूरी के बिना कर्मचारियों द्वारा शुरू की गई हड़ताल
example: The workers went on a wildcat strike.

meaning: Hypocrite / a dangerous person pretending to be harmless
hindiMeaning: भेड़ की खाल में भेड़िया (खतरनाक व्यक्ति)
example: He is a wolf in sheep’s clothing.

meaning: Essential fact
example: You should know the ABC of computers.

meaning: Honest and frank / without any secret
example: His dealings are above board.

meaning: Beyond one's capability to understand something
example: This topic is over my head.

meaning: A weakness or vulnerable point
example: Pride is his Achilles’ heel.

meaning: Definitive proof of truth or falsehood / A fact, event or situation that proves something
example: This exam is the acid test.

meaning: What you do is more important than what you say / What you do reveals the real you / Intentions can be judged by people's actions
hindiMeaning: कथनी से अधिक करनी बोलती है
example: He proved himself—actions speak louder than words.

meaning: Water
example: Adam’s ale is the best drink.

meaning: Make things worse / worsen the difficult situation
example: His comment added fuel to the fire.

meaning: To further a loss with mockery / Make a bad situation even worse
example: His words added insult to injury.

meaning: To only a certain extent
example: He understands English after a fashion.

meaning: Sharing or having one's tastes or views / Having likes and dislikes similar to one's own
example: He is a man after my own heart.

meaning: Work very fast to complete something within a deadline / work in great hurry, as fast as possible
example: We are working against the clock.

meaning: To help someone to commit a crime
hindiMeaning: अपराध के लिए उकसाना या मदद करना
example: He was punished for aiding and abetting.

meaning: A place that contains many interesting objects
hindiMeaning: अत्यधिक धन या रोचक वस्तुओं का स्थान
example: This shop is like Aladdin’s cave.

meaning: Confused activity and uproar
example: There were alarums and excursions in the market.

meaning: In good health
example: He is alive and kicking.

meaning: Amazed / Full of interest and excitement
example: The children were all agog.

meaning: All the time / from the beginning
example: I knew the truth all along.

meaning: Everybody without distinction / All included
example: All and sundry were invited.

phrase: All at sea / Feel at sea
meaning: Puzzled / state of confusion / lost and confused
example: I was all at sea during the exam.

meaning: Full of talk, but low on action
hindiMeaning: जो गरजते हैं वे बरसते नहीं

meaning: Watching eagerly / To watch something intently
example: Everyone was all eyes on the stage.

meaning: To be attentive

meaning: Everyone available to help with a problem
hindiMeaning: समस्या के मदद के लिए सभी का उपलब्ध होना

meaning: One who is full of big talk but lacks substance and action
example: He is all hat and no cattle.

meaning: Exhausted

meaning: Part of a person's typical work

meaning: Having all authority / considering everything

meaning: Far from reality / concocted / nonsense

meaning: Quickly and unexpectedly
example: It started raining all of a sudden.

meaning: Full force
example: They tried with all their might and main.

meaning: Everywhere

meaning: Clumsy / physically awkward

meaning: Completely mistaken
example: Your idea is all wet.

phrase: All's fair in love and war
meaning: Any action is acceptable in extreme circumstances like love or war
hindiMeaning: प्यार और युद्ध में सब जायज है
example: Don’t complain—all’s fair in love and war.

meaning: Institution where I got education
example: This college is my alma mater.

meaning: Beginning and end

meaning: A metaphor for an abundance of abbreviations or acronyms
hindiMeaning: शब्दों के लघुरूप का अत्यधिक प्रयोग

phrase: Always a bridesmaid never a bride
meaning: Someone who is never the most important person in a particular situation
hindiMeaning: सबसे महत्वपूर्ण पद के बाद वाला स्थान
example: He is always a bridesmaid, never a bride.

meaning: Complete change of opinion
example: He took an about turn.

meaning: A major advantage that one keeps hidden until an ideal time
example: He has an ace in the hole.

meaning: Someone who gives advice based on theory not practice
hindiMeaning: बिना व्यावहारिक अनुभव के आलोचना करना

meaning: Strategies that can be followed
hindiMeaning: उपलब्ध विकल्पों में से एक विकल्प
example: This plan is another arrow in our quiver.

meaning: A firmly held belief

meaning: A shocking revelation

meaning: Strict and harsh control

meaning: A firm opinion / strong determination

phrase: An old head on young shoulders
meaning: Full of wisdom

meaning: Gesture of peace

meaning: One that held no secrets / one about whom it is easy to know everything / straightforward and honest
hindiMeaning: खुली किताब (जिसके बारे में सब कुछ पता हो)
example: He is an open book.

meaning: Difficult task

meaning: Appeal to the highest possible authority
example: He decided to appeal to Caesar.

meaning: Reason for quarrel / Cause of animosity / something that causes friction / Bone of contention
example: Property became the apple of discord.

meaning: Someone very precious or dear

meaning: Spoil careful plans
example: His mistake upset the apple-cart.

meaning: Two unlike things or people / Unequal comparisons
example: You are comparing apples and oranges.

meaning: Having no relevance to any previous discussion or situation

meaning: Carefully observant or attentive / Vigilant

meaning: Heavily armed or fortified

meaning: Day and night

meaning: Occurring soon

meaning: Actually as it happens
example: As a matter of fact, I was there.

phrase: As bald as a cue ball
meaning: Completely bald

meaning: Readily understood

meaning: Impossible to understand

meaning: Extremely silly

meaning: Unquestionably dead or inoperative
example: The phone is dead as a doornail.

meaning: Strong and healthy / In a perfectly healthy condition
example: After rest, he is fit as a fiddle.

meaning: A person who is obedient and well-behaved
example: The child is as good as gold.

meaning: Emotionless / unrelenting / to have no feelings

meaning: Intoxicated with alcohol

meaning: Very enthusiastic and excited

phrase: As phony as a three-dollar bill
meaning: Something that is fake

meaning: Smart and clever

meaning: The shortest route / measurement in a straight line

meaning: Extremely stupid

meaning: Act in a way that is likely to incur problems or difficulties

meaning: Not attentive to one's duties

meaning: Pretend superiority

meaning: A point in life where his decisions will have long term consequences

meaning: Unable to decide

meaning: Do something very slowly

meaning: To do something continuously
example: He studied for five hours at a stretch.

meaning: Under all circumstances

meaning: At his disposal / to be dominated by someone / be always ready at her service
example: He is at his boss’s beck and call.

meaning: Having opposing viewpoints or intentions
example: They were talking at cross purposes.

meaning: Enemies / To be bitterly hostile / Being at loggerheads
hindiMeaning: शत्रु या संघर्ष की स्थिति में
example: They are at daggers drawn.

meaning: Arguing angrily
example: They were at each other’s throats.

meaning: A criminal escaped or not yet captured
example: The thief is still at large.

meaning: In conflict with someone / To disagree strongly
example: They are at loggerheads.

meaning: In an uncertain situation
example: I am feeling at loose ends.

meaning: Next to someone
example: He was at my elbow.

meaning: Completely confused or perplexed
example: I am at my wit’s end.

meaning: In a random manner
example: He picked a book at random.

meaning: With little warning or time for preparation
example: He came at short notice.

meaning: In disorder or confusion
example: Everything was at sixes and sevens.

meaning: Paid for by someone

meaning: In danger

phrase: At the drop of a hat/dime
meaning: Without any hesitation / instantly / without having planned beforehand
example: He agreed at the drop of a hat.

meaning: At the very last moment / Just before the deadline

phrase: At the top of your lungs
meaning: Extremely loudly
example: He shouted at the top of his lungs.

meaning: In opposite
example: His views are at variance with mine.

meaning: To produce a result that is even and balanced when looked at over a period of time

meaning: A young defenceless person

meaning: Resume duty
